title: How to improve my scientific knowledge easily - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello, I would like to keep my answer simple and straight. Firstly, improvement doesn't come easily, you need to work hard towards it. Now I can suggest you a way where you can work hard and quit instantly you will find the effect. I believe that you must have a chosen domain where you want to improve your scientific knowledge. The easiest way is to refer to the journals related to the field and discuss whatever you get to know from the paper with your professor or friends. If you do this, then firstly while reading the scientific journal you are gathering knowledge and while discussing you are sharpening your concepts and you might encounter new ideas too while discussion. If you complete a large number of journals, then after a certain interval of time you will find yourself in a strong position regarding the scientific field you have chosen to study and learn. If you plan to just know scientific works in general, then there are many online portals which feed you with daily updates. You can go through them and don't forget to discuss and enlighten about the knowledge you have gained with others. As sharing knowledge never reduces your knowledge but it increases your knowledge. Thank you.

Hello! The easiest way to improve your scientific knowledge is to start studying something you already like. Let's say you like music, or already are a musician, you can study the science behind musical tunes and their effect on us, the varying tones and how each tone triggers certain emotions in humans etc. As you start exploring the subject you like in a scientific manner, you'll notice there are other aspects to it which are related to another field. The study of music is also tied to neuroscience at a certain level, as it deals with music's effects on brain waves(This is just an example) In its essence, all sciences are connected, and it's almost impossible to not come across some aspect of another science while you're studying your area of interest! As you study like this with interest and enthusiasm, you'll see yourself easily expanding your scientific knowledge and vocabulary. I could've easily suggested you to just buy random scientific books and read them but you wouldn't be able to do so, as even though you might have purchased some books, you would lack the devotion needed to study them. Once you approach learning in this way, it'll be far easier to learn any kind of scientific knowledge and you'll find your information base expanding at a rapid rate!!

Scientific knowledge applied has helped humanity but theoretical knowledge alone cannot do good; so improving your knowledge means find technology for it so that humanity can take advantage of such knowledge and as you know knowledge is like a huge ocean and one may know in his life only little of it and the unknown remains what it was. Even known knowledge is not fully known and liable to change; what was once considered as Fact later on found to be Fiction or imagination, so be careful about such uncertainties in the field of science. Everything is relative in this world of ours including Truth; different people assert about it differently in different situations within their limited imperfect existence; there are religious views, philosophical views, etc. Science has also limitations as it depends solely on objective things and exclude the subjective factors involved in it, the inside knowledge powered by the soul of man. We have a wide reservoir of traditional knowledge and its usage in life. Scientists cannot ignore such things. They should probe on all such knowledge prevalent among common people all over the world and provide them with the scientific basis for it all because the traditional knowledge is spread over every sector of life enriching it from time immemorial.
